sn19.14:1.1: “Just now, reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a stinking fishwife flying through the air.
sn19.14:1.2: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing her, pecking, plucking, and hacking
sn19.14:1.4: “That woman used to be a fortune-teller right here in Rājagaha. …”
